Module com.example.miniproyecto4
Package com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Player

Interface IPlayer

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ComputerPlayer, Player
public interface IPlayer extends Serializable
Interface defining the contract for a player in the Battleship game. Extends Serializable to support game state persistence. Provides methods for managing player identity, board access, and game statistics.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    IBoard
    getBoard()
    Returns the game board associated with this player.
    String

    Returns the player's nickname.

  • Method Details

    • getNickname

      String getNickname()
      Returns the player's nickname.
      Returns:
      the player's nickname

    • setNickname

      void setNickname(String nickname)
      Sets the player's nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the new nickname for the player

    • getBoard

      IBoard getBoard()
      Returns the game board associated with this player.
      Returns:
      the player's game board

    • getSunkShipsCount

      int getSunkShipsCount()
      Returns the number of opponent's ships that this player has sunk.
      Returns:
      the count of sunk ships

    • hasLost

      boolean hasLost()
      Checks if the player has lost the game. A player loses when all of their ships have been sunk.
      Returns:
      true if the player has lost, false otherwise

    • incrementSunkShips

      void incrementSunkShips()
      Increments the count of ships that this player has sunk. Called when the player successfully sinks an opponent's ship.

    • reset

      void reset()
      Resets the player to their initial state. Clears the board and resets all statistics.
